unnormalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Reels Out, But Are They Worth the Samosas?**
normalised: **Entertainment News: Bollywood Reels Out, But Are They Worth the Samosas?**

unnormalised: Mumbai: This Diwali, your gut might be happier than your cinema-loving soul. A barrage of Bollywood releases hit theaters, thicker than the festive traffic on the Western Express Highway.
normalised: Mumbai: This Diwali, your gut might be happier than your cinema-loving soul. A barrage of Bollywood releases hit theaters, thicker than the festive traffic on the Western Express Highway.

unnormalised: First up, “Prem Ki Biryani,” a rom-com starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor. Early reviews suggest it’s as predictable as finding your family fighting over real estate on Diwali.
normalised: First up, “Prem Ki Biryani,” a rom-com starring Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor. Early reviews suggest it’s as predictable as finding your family fighting over real estate on Diwali.

unnormalised: Then there’s "Action Jackson Returns...Again!" starring Ajay Devgn battling villains across 5 countries. Critics are wondering if even Singham can save this one. Word is, the scriptwriter went on a 3-day Onam celebration and just forgot to finish the plot.
normalised: Then there’s "Action Jackson Returns...Again!" starring Ajay Devgn battling villains across five countries. Critics are wondering if even Singham can save this one. Word is, the scriptwriter went on a three-day Onam celebration and just forgot to finish the plot.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, smaller indie flick, “Auto Raja's Revenge,” filmed entirely in Bengaluru for Rs. 5 lakhs, is surprisingly gaining traction. Seems audiences are tired of the same old masala.
normalised: Meanwhile, smaller indie flick, “Auto Raja's Revenge,” filmed entirely in Bengaluru for rupees five lakhs, is surprisingly gaining traction. Seems audiences are tired of the same old masala.

unnormalised: So, before you spend Rs. 500 on a movie ticket, maybe just order a large biryani and settle in for some classic Bollywood reruns. Your wallet (and maybe your sanity) will thank you.
normalised: So, before you spend rupees five hundred on a movie ticket, maybe just order a large biryani and settle in for some classic Bollywood reruns. Your wallet (and maybe your sanity) will thank you.
